alert.note: Alert for Greenwood (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 8:36AM EST until January 04 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Greenwood County in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 AM EST, It is possible that another inch of rain will fall this morning aggrevating ongoing high water conditions countywide. Please remain wary of rising stream levels and the redevelopment of flooding in low-lying areas, especially throughout the city of Greenwood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenwood, Ninety Six, Cokesbury, Hodges, Troy, Ninety Six Historic Site, Lake Greenwood, Greenwood State Park, Promised Land, Bradley, Coronaca, Epworth, Callison, Kirksey and Dyson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
